author: Jesper Fjeldstad
title: Mundine ‘ain’t coming out’ for anthem
text:
ANTHONY Mundine has brought the anthem debate to a halt by declaring he will refuse to come out to the ring during Advance Australia Fair at Adelaide Oval on Friday night. 
Mundine’s arch rival and opponent, Danny Green, was unperturbed by the announcement at the venue today, while Mundine received support from his father, former champion Tony.
Promoters confirmed that the anthem would be played, but Anthony Mundine repeated his stance repeatedly: “I ain’t coming out.”
Meanwhile, Green spoke of going for a run around Adelaide Oval on Tuesday night as part of his preparation for the bout.
He said he could not be any more impressed with the South Australian icon.
Wednesday’s press conference was delayed after Green was stopped to be drug tested, only for Mundine to cheekily suggest that his archrival — who has been installed as an overwhelming favourite — could do with any help he could get.
MORE TO COME 
Originally published as Mundine ‘ain’t coming out’ for anthem
